Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: rclone
Description: The Swiss army knife of cloud storage

Arguments.Name: --help
Arguments.Description: Show help for rclone commands, flags and backends

Arguments.Name: about
Arguments.Description: Get quota information from the remote

Arguments.Name: --full
Arguments.Description: Full numbers instead of SI units

Arguments.Name: --auth-no-open-browser
Arguments.Description: Do not automatically open auth link in default browser

Arguments.Name: cat
Arguments.Description: Concatenates any files and sends them to stdout

Arguments.Name: --discard
Arguments.Description: Discard the output instead of printing

Arguments.Name: --head
Arguments.Description: Only print the first N characters

Arguments.Name: --offset
Arguments.Description: Start printing at offset N (or from end if -ve)

Arguments.Name: --tail
Arguments.Description: Only print the last N characters

Arguments.Name: check
Arguments.Description: Checks the files in the source and destination match

Arguments.Name: --download
Arguments.Description: Check by downloading rather than with hash

Arguments.Name: --combined
Arguments.Description: Make a combined report of changes to this file

Arguments.Name: --differ
Arguments.Description: Report all non-matching files to this file

Arguments.Name: --error
Arguments.Description: Report all files with errors (hashing or reading) to this file

Arguments.Name: --match
Arguments.Description: Report all matching files to this file

Arguments.Name: --missing-on-dst
Arguments.Description: Report all files missing from the destination to this file

Arguments.Name: --missing-on-src
Arguments.Description: Report all files missing from the source to this file

Arguments.Name: --one-way
Arguments.Description: Check one way only, source files must exist on remote

Arguments.Name: cleanup
Arguments.Description: Clean up the remote if possible

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Create a new remote with name, type and options

Arguments.Name: copy
Arguments.Description: Copy files from source to dest, skipping already copied

Arguments.Name: copyto
Arguments.Description: Copy files from source to dest, skipping already copied

Arguments.Name: cryptcheck
Arguments.Description: Cryptcheck checks the integrity of a crypted remote

Arguments.Name: --combined
Arguments.Description: Make a combined report of changes to this file

Arguments.Name: --differ
Arguments.Description: Report all non-matching files to this file

Arguments.Name: --error
Arguments.Description: Report all files with errors (hashing or reading) to this file

Arguments.Name: --match
Arguments.Description: Report all matching files to this file

Arguments.Name: --missing-on-dst
Arguments.Description: Report all files missing from the destination to this file

Arguments.Name: --missing-on-src
Arguments.Description: Report all files missing from the source to this file

Arguments.Name: --one-way
Arguments.Description: Check one way only, source files must exist on remote

Arguments.Name: dedupe
Arguments.Description: Interactively find duplicate filenames and delete/rename them

Arguments.Name: --by-hash
Arguments.Description: Find identical hashes rather than names

Arguments.Name: skip
Arguments.Description: Removes identical files then skips anything left

Arguments.Name: rename
Arguments.Description: Removes identical files then renames the rest to be different

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists duplicate dirs and files only and changes nothing

Arguments.Name: first
Arguments.Description: removes identical files then keeps the first one.

Arguments.Name: newest
Arguments.Description: removes identical files then keeps the newest one.

Arguments.Name: oldest
Arguments.Description: removes identical files then keeps the oldest one.

Arguments.Name: largest
Arguments.Description: removes identical files then keeps the largest one.

Arguments.Name: smallest
Arguments.Description: removes identical files then keeps the smallest one.

Arguments.Name: --rmdirs
Arguments.Description: Rmdirs removes empty directories but leaves root intact

Arguments.Name: deletefile
Arguments.Description: Remove a single file from remote

Arguments.Name: genautocomplete
Arguments.Description: Output completion script for a given shell

Arguments.Name: bash
Arguments.Description: Output bash completion script for rclone.

Arguments.Name: fish
Arguments.Description: Output fish completion script for rclone.

Arguments.Name: zsh
Arguments.Description: Output zsh completion script for rclone.

Arguments.Name: gendocs
Arguments.Description: Output markdown docs for rclone to the directory supplied

Arguments.Name: hashsum
Arguments.Description: Produces a hashsum file for all the objects in the path

Arguments.Name: --download
Arguments.Description: Download the file and hash it locally; if this flag is not specified, the hash is requested from the remote

Arguments.Name: --output-file
Arguments.Description: Output hashsums to a file rather than the terminal

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Show help for rclone commands, flags and backends

Arguments.Name: --expire
Arguments.Description: The amount of time that the link will be valid (default 100y)

Arguments.Name: --unlink
Arguments.Description: Remove existing public link to file/folder

Arguments.Name: listremotes
Arguments.Description: List all the remotes in the config file

Arguments.Name: --long
Arguments.Description: Show the type as well as names

Arguments.Name: ls
Arguments.Description: List the objects in the path with size and path

Arguments.Name: lsd
Arguments.Description: List all directories/containers/buckets in the path

Arguments.Name: lsf
Arguments.Description: List directories and objects in remote:path formatted for parsing

Arguments.Name: --absolute
Arguments.Description: Put a leading / in front of path names

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Append a slash to directory names. (default true)

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: Output format - see  help for details (default "p")

Arguments.Name: --hash
Arguments.Description: Use this hash when h is used in the format (default "MD5")

Arguments.Name: --separator
Arguments.Description: Separator for the items in the format. (default ";")

Arguments.Name: lsjson
Arguments.Description: List directories and objects in the path in JSON format

Arguments.Name: --hash
Arguments.Description: Include hashes in the output (may take longer)

Arguments.Name: --hash-type
Arguments.Description: Show only this hash type (may be repeated)

Arguments.Name: --no-mimetype
Arguments.Description: Don't read the mime type (can speed things up)

Arguments.Name: --no-modtime
Arguments.Description: Don't read the modification time (can speed things up)

Arguments.Name: --original
Arguments.Description: Show the ID of the underlying Object

Arguments.Name: lsl
Arguments.Description: List the objects in path with modification time, size and path

Arguments.Name: md5sum
Arguments.Description: Produces an md5sum file for all the objects in the path

Arguments.Name: --download
Arguments.Description: Download the file and hash it locally; if this flag is not specified, the hash is requested from the remote

Arguments.Name: --output-file
Arguments.Description: Output hashsums to a file rather than the terminal

Arguments.Name: mkdir
Arguments.Description: Make the path if it doesn't already exist

Arguments.Name: mount
Arguments.Description: Mount the remote as file system on a mountpoint

Arguments.Name: move
Arguments.Description: Move files from source to dest

Arguments.Name: moveto
Arguments.Description: Move file or directory from source to dest

Arguments.Name: ncdu
Arguments.Description: Explore a remote with a text based user interface

Arguments.Name: obscure
Arguments.Description: Obscure password for use in the rclone config file

Arguments.Name: purge
Arguments.Description: Remove the path and all of its contents

Arguments.Name: rc
Arguments.Description: Run a command against a running rclone

Arguments.Name: rcat
Arguments.Description: Copies standard input to file on remote

Arguments.Name: rcd
Arguments.Description: Run rclone listening to remote control commands only

Arguments.Name: rmdir
Arguments.Description: Remove the empty directory at path

Arguments.Name: rmdirs
Arguments.Description: Remove empty directories under the path

Arguments.Name: serve
Arguments.Description: Serve a remote over a protocol

Arguments.Name: settier
Arguments.Description: Changes storage class/tier of objects in remote

Arguments.Name: sha1sum
Arguments.Description: Produces an sha1sum file for all the objects in the path

Arguments.Name: size
Arguments.Description: Prints the total size and number of objects in remote:path

Arguments.Name: sync
Arguments.Description: Make source and dest identical, modifying destination only

Arguments.Name: touch
Arguments.Description: Create new file or change file modification time

Arguments.Name: tree
Arguments.Description: List the contents of the remote in a tree like fashion
